p: Targeted sequencing with MinION is powerful and fast to detect pathogens in clinical samples. Bacterial composition from empyema patient’s pleural effusion could be understood within 2 hours after obtaining the DNA sample [ 29]. Here, the amplicons of 16s rRNA gene were sequenced to identify the bacteria. Due to the capability of long-read sequencing, the gene can be sequenced in entirety, increasing the resolution to detect the infecting bacteria species. Bioinformatics tools can be used to increase the accuracy of the amplicons and determine the bacteria composition up to species level [ 30]. The employment of targeted sequencing using 285 and 256 primer pairs enabled the recognition of the causative agent of viral hemorrhagic fever within 10 min of sequencing, and a definitive diagnosis can be procured in less than 3.5 h [ 31].
